programme.title: Wildest India: India's Lost World
programme.desc: North-east India is an anthropological paradise; there is no other place on Earth with so many different ethnic groups. The forest are filled with mysterious tribes whose lives are dictated by the rain and the seasonal fruits of the forest.

programme.title: Wildest India: Ganges: River of Life
programme.desc: Then watch, the longest river in India, The Ganges. It's a lifeline to wild animals, from rhinoceros and river dolphins to otters and gharials.

programme.title: Wildest India: The Himalayas: Surviving the Summits
programme.desc: The Himalayas run across 2,500km of north India. he Himalayas' rugged highlands offer little direct refuge to humans, in the shadow below, over a billion people in India rely on the mountains for survival.

programme.title: Wildest India: Western Ghats: Monsoon Mountains
programme.desc: See how the Himalayas run across 2,500km of north India.The Himalayas' highlands offer little direct refuge to humans. /Then, learn about the western Ghats. A spine of mountains that lay claim to being one of the most bio-diverse places in the world.

programme.title: Wildest India: Thar Desert: Sacred Sands
programme.desc: Covering 200,000 km sq, India's Thar desert is one of the harshest places on Earth. Desiccating winds and near permanent drought has earned this unforgiving land another name: the region of death.

programme.title: The Man Without A Face

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Baby Lyssa Steps Up

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Mystery of Mona Lisa

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Name

programme.title: Paranormal State: School House Haunting

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Samlesbury Hall P2

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Shrewsbury Prison

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Shrewsbury Prison

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Shrewsbury Prison Pt1

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Shrewsbury Prison Pt2

programme.title: World's Greatest: Glaciers
programme.desc: Clinging to the world’s highest mountains and forming ice caps on both poles, glaciers leave an impression on the landscape and on all who bear witness to their splendor.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coral Islands
programme.desc: The reef systems that gave rise to coral islands support the vast majority of marine species on our planet, but they are under threat. Explore the delicate balance between exploiting and preserving these extraordinary natural wonders.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Nearshore Islands
programme.desc: Some of the world’s greatest islands are so close that they blend in with the mainland. But regardless of their size and origins, they are often the islands we are drawn to the most, each forging their own unique identity.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: Extreme Animals features environments hostile to humans, but havens to many animals. Witness gorgeous glow-worms, high flying condors, parched thorny devils, emperor penguins, and polar bears in this journey through life on the edge.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Jungle Animals
programme.desc: Encounter gorillas and orangutans, killer tree-dwelling pythons, delightful monkeys, awe-inspiring tigers, and millions of land-dwelling red crabs in Australia, the islands of Southeast Asia, Africa, and the Amazon.

programme.title: Arthur: Binky Barnes, Wingman/To Beat Or Not To Beat
programme.desc: Does Binky have a favorite pastime? Not until citywide Bug Week, when suddenly all he can think about is butterflies. Then, there's a horrible racket in Elwood City, and it's Francine practicing her singing and drumming for the Talent Show!

programme.title: Arthur: No Acting Please/Prunella Deegan and the Disappointing Ending
programme.desc: When Fern lands a role in a community production, she fears she's not talented enough to be a star. Finally, the final volume of the Henry Screever series is out. Prunella and Marina compete to see who can finish the book the fastest.

programme.title: Arthur: Mr. Ratburn's Secret Identity/Besties
programme.desc: Mysterious calls. Superhuman strength. Is Mr. Ratburn secretly a superhero? When Buster and Ladonna bond over a memorable trip to the movies, Arthur feels left out. Has Ladonna taken his place as Buster's best bud?

programme.title: Arthur: Get Smart/Baby Steps
programme.desc: Everyone loves HUGO--the new interactive whiteboard that claims to be 100% accurate. If only Mr. Ratburn knew how to use it. Mei Lin can say "hello" AND play the piano?!? Kate can't even wave!

programme.title: Arthur: George Scraps His Sculpture/Arthur's Big Meltdown
programme.desc: George creates a piece of art for the county-wide art show with the help of guest artist Kevin Sampson. Then, Arthur must learn how to control his temper after getting angry over a pair of sneakers!

programme.title: Arthur: Kids Are From Earth, Parents Are From Pluto/Nerves Of Steal
programme.desc: It’s Lakewood Elementary Parents Open House! How will the kids survive a whole evening of their parents' embarrassing antics? Buster is the only kid in Elwood City who doesn't have a Cybertoy, so he decides to 'borrow' one from the store.

programme.title: Arthur: Dear Adil/Bitzi's Break-Up
programme.desc: Arthur is worried that his letters to his new Turkish pen pal, Adil, will be boring. After all, how can Elwood City compare to Arthur's fantastical ideas about Turkey? Bitzi is breaking up with her boyfriend, and Buster is really sad.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W. Thinks Big/Arthur Cleans Up
programme.desc: Once again, Arthur gets to do everything. Mostly he gets to carry the ring in Aunt Lucy's wedding. Elwood City's park is in sad shape, and after grumbling about it, the kids find themselves volunteered to clean it up.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W.'S Stray Netkitin/Bats in the Belfry
programme.desc: D.W. is panicked when a virus ruins the Read family computer. Who will take care of her virtual pet? Arthur and D.W. are thrilled when Grandma Thora lets them turn her attic into a clubhouse. But will a bat threaten their new play space?

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: The second world war was conflict on an unprecedented scale. Its battles set new marks for the sheer size of forces deployed and for the power of their weapons. In this episode we study the first battle at sea, and the largest army to have ever marched.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: A war that reached every continent and touched every sort of terrain demanded every sort of strategy. In this episode we examine battles fought at sea, and in the jungle, in city streets, invasions from the air, and retreats from the land.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: Battles are almost always about territory. Advancing the front line, seizing the port, the city, the oil field. The fate of nations in the war rose and fell on battles that took territory. Singapore, Monte Casino, Stalingrad...all about territory.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: Every war seized new tactics; some inspired, some desperate, all attempting to influence the course of battles. Campaigns waged against non military targets to demoralize. Suicide missions launched when traditional weapons failed. Rules were rewritten.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: A world war is a patchwork of actions. Land. Sea. Air. Massive, or small scale. The stories of these actions, are just as varied. This episode describes battles of amphibious forces, climate, geography, and the problems of supply.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: Through history, armies marched to face each other on favored ground and clashed to decide a campaign, a war, an empire. With the 20th century that changed. The battles of the WWII happened anywhere and everywhere, in every weather and climate.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Keyonnah & Bow Wow
programme.desc: Superfan Keyonnah can hardly believe her luck, she's almost certain that she's been having an online relationship with her childhood crush, the rapper Bow Wow. Is this too good to be true?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Courtney & Isaak
programme.desc: Courtney broke up with Isaak, who she met online. He's doing everything to get her back. Beauty queen Cassidy Wolf joins Nev to get Isaak to leave Courtney alone for good. (S4, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Rico & Ja'Mari
programme.desc: Rico wants to move to England to care for his ailing mother, but his intense online relationship with Ja'mari, an international male model, is giving him second thoughts about leaving.

programme.title: Catfish UK: Luke & Amy
programme.desc: Drummer Luke first started talking to nurse Amy when she came to one of his gigs 6 months ago. They had an instant spark but unfortunately every time they try and meet she cancels. (S2, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Jarrod & Abby
programme.desc: How do young people who've embraced the digital age find love? Often by connecting online with others they've never met in person before. The problem -- that cute guy you may be falling in love with could be lying about who he really is.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Bianca & Brogan
programme.desc: When Brogan disappears from the Internet, then returns online after a year without question, Bianca wants to know what happened in the missing year. (S3, ep10)

programme.title: The Hills: Apology Not Accepted / Everyone Falls
programme.desc: Lauren's turning 21 and Heidi has big plans for the birthday bash. But, before the party, Heidi decides it's time to tell Lauren about Spencer's big idea to move in together. (S2, ep10)

programme.title: The City: The British Are Coming
programme.desc: Olivia's flubs during Fashion Week leave an opening that Erin quickly tries to fill with a new fashion reporter. Roxy impresses Kelly by helping to produce a huge fashion show. (S2, ep7)

programme.title: The City: Work Horses And Show Ponies
programme.desc: Whitney and Roxy fly to Miami to put on a fashion show for Whitney's clothing line, without Kelly's help! Olivia fights for her job by scoring an interview with Zac Posen. (S2, ep8)

programme.title: The City: One Girl's Trash...
programme.desc: After a successful showing of her line, Whitney's first big sale almost ends in disaster. Erin thinks Olivia is taking undue credit for pulling the perfect look for an ELLE shoot. (S2, ep9)

programme.title: The City: Stage Fight
programme.desc: Roxy &amp; Whitney have a falling out when Roxy dresses a new musician in Whitney's clothing. Erin gains a spot on the Martha Stewart Show &amp; needs Olivia's help to make it a success. (S2, ep10)

programme.title: The City: Roommate Wanted
programme.desc: Roxy &amp; Whitney continue to fight &amp; Roxy looks for her own place. Olivia reluctantly interviews a celebrity wearing Whitney's line &amp; Erin sees another opportunity to replace her. (S2, ep11)

programme.title: The City: Lost In Translation
programme.desc: Whitney faces a challenge when a PR company offers to represent her line, threatening her relationship with Kelly. Erin makes a final play in her effort to get Olivia replaced. (S2, ep12)

programme.title: The City: If She Can Make It Here...
programme.desc: Whitney arrives in New York City during fashion week just in time to start her new career with iconic designer, Diane Von Furstenberg. (S1, ep1)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Ciao, Italia
programme.desc: Mike's antics have proven too much and Ron demands he make amends. As the crew count down the days until their return to Seaside, Mike wonders whether or not to join them at the Shore. (S4, ep12)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Season 4 Reunion
programme.desc: After a summer full of popping and breaking bottles, heartache, hookups, and car-crashing, wall-smashing drama, the cast reunite to open up old wounds and say goodbye to Florence.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Murder at Sea?
programme.desc: The disappearance of newlywed George Smith, who vanished from a cruise in the Mediterranean. This report uncovers the questionable alibis, failed polygraphs and a provocative video that involves the three men who last saw Smith alive.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Deadly Prophecy
programme.desc: Faylene Eaves, divorced Arizona mother of two, married Doug Grant, a divorced single dad, in 1993. They were both Mormons. Faylene had revelations from God that could have contributed to her death, however her husband was found guilty of murdering her.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Family Torn Apart
programme.desc: The murdered body of Bob Dorotik, a engineer and father of three, was found by a mountain road near his home in the foothills of San Diego, Ca. Despite her denial of any involvement, Jane, Dorotik’s wife of 30 years, was arrested for the crime.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Live to Tell: One Last Hug
programme.desc: An updated report on growing dangers of dating and breakup violence, focusing on Melissa Dohme, who agreed to meet a former boyfriend, Robert Burton, for one last hug before they broke up forever. The decision nearly cost her her life.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Murder in the Hamptons
programme.desc: A report on the October 2001 murder of Wall Street tycoon Ted Ammon who was embroiled in a bitter divorce battle with his wife Generosa who later died of breast cancer.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Driven to Extremes
programme.desc: Mary Hill was driving three teens, when her BMW crashed and killed two of them. Hill claims she lost control as the car sped up on its own, but investigators say she was driving recklessly. Hill was charged with vehicular homicide and manslaughter.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield discovers Jon’s new ventriloquist dummy is alive. Jon decides to take up skydiving.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Jon and Garfield end up in the ring wrestling the Masked Mauler. Leftovers run rampant in Jon’s refrigerator.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield tells of when an exterminator and his cat are sent to the Doctor’s home.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Feline Felon/Legal Eagle/The Cactus Saga
programme.desc: Garfield steals a pie./When Orson discovers a book of rules./How the Cactu family got their nick-name.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Basket Brawl/The Origin of Power Pig/Cactus Jake Rides Again
programme.desc: Jon, Odie & Nermal's attempt to go on a picnic./Orson tells how he became Power Pig./Cactus Jake moves in with Jon.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Nermal wishes upon a star that Garfield could switch places with him.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Jon gets a speeding ticket but Garfield suspects foul play. Wade tries some imagining of his own.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield gets free pizza. Jon’s new car falls in love with him.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Garfield tells how it was the Wright brothers’ cat that first flew at Kitty Hawk.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Nerves
programme.desc: Christopher George guest stars in the role of a psychotic ex-convict determined to wreak vengeance on society.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Run for the Money
programme.desc: Guest stars Richard Jaeckel and Herbert Edelman play gangsters who try to get control of all the illegal betting parlors in the country as well as a virtual takeover of all thoroughbred horse racing.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Connection
programme.desc: Jim Phelps and his IMF team are given the assignment of breaking an underworld ring attempting to set up one of the world's largest drug manufacturing plants off the coast of Africa.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Bride
programme.desc: Casey poses as a young peasant girl from Europe imported to be the bride of Joe Corvin, the top man at getting underworld millions into Swiss banks.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Stone Pillow
programme.desc: Guest star Bradford Dillman plays Edison, a former private detective turned extortionist who is blackmailing a powerful crime chief with a roll of film linking him to murder.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop has trouble following the rules and taking turns while playing games. BJ hurts his toe while pretending to be Captain Pickles.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Everybody's Got Feelings
programme.desc: Barney helps Baby Bop and BJ learn that everyone has feelings—happy, sad, angry—and sometimes all those feelings can be experienced in just one day.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Here Kitty, Kitty
programme.desc: When Miss Jo loses her cat, Barney and the children spend the day helping her find it. Along the way, they learn all about cats.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Numbers! Numbers!
programme.desc: Tony shares a box full of numbers that he made with his dad. He is showing them off when a gust of wind blows them all away. Barney and the kids decide to go on a number hunt. They soon find Baby Bop and their hunt takes the group all over the park.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Sharing Is Caring!

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Arrival
programme.desc: A Taelon shuttle is shot down over Antarctica. There are Jiridians aboard, but two of the passengers escape. When Augur discovers Lili's blood on the ship, he is convinced that she is not dead.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Forge of Creation
programme.desc: Lili, Vorjak, and the baby flee to find a shuttle to escape Earth. Liam and Sandoval are both tracking them - for different reasons. Augur is on the run from volunteers, but sends a friend (Juliet) to help Liam while he's gone.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: First Breath
programme.desc: A college friend of Renee's resurfaces and leads them on an investigation of the link between the Taelons and a biomedical facility's cloning operation.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Sins of the Father
programme.desc: A Senator's daughter is found to have kryss in her system. Liam and Renee suspect the Taelons lied about synthesizing it and there is a new location for production. They believe Federov is involved. Da'an is addicted to kryss.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Limbo
programme.desc: The Taelons lend some of their dwindling core energy to Joshua Doors for a pilot cold fusion project, but the energy is stolen, leaving the Taelons vulnerable. Jonathan Doors lives on as an AI in cyberspace.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Pirate's Curse
programme.desc: A seismic event opens the earth and send Marguerite and Roxton into a pit, where they discover a pirate's buried treasure...and his bones. A curse on the booty complicates matters.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Visitor
programme.desc: After Malone is attacked by a beast, he and Veronica meet her old friend Danu, who has also been injured. Danu goes missing, and the group travels to his village learning he is a werewolf.

programme.title: The Lost World: A Man of Vision
programme.desc: The five adventurers all experience visions of Summerlee, the companion they had presumed dead after he disappeared into a waterfall. They suffer injury and face danger as they pursue the vision.

programme.title: The Lost World: Into the Fire
programme.desc: The incredible occurs when a Navy airship flies over the plateau. Malone manages to climb aboard, but is ambushed once inside and meets the deceptive Captain Askwith.

programme.title: The Lost World: Out of the Blue
programme.desc: Marguerite, Roxton, and Challenger take the place of Askwith aboard his ghost ship and return to the day of its fatal departure in 1915. Back on the Plateau, Veronica chases down Askwith.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Travelers
programme.desc: Malone remains missing, and the explorers' search party crosses paths with a trio of travelers. Marguerite becomes taken with the dashing leader, especially when he offers her a way off the Plateau.

programme.title: Catfish UK: Neil & Jasmin
programme.desc: Neil has been chatting to Jasmin for 3 years and she's stood him up 13 times. So it's up to Julie and Oobah to find out if the person Neil has fallen for...is real? (S1, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Tasheeka & Aaron
programme.desc: After avoiding video calls for 2 years, Tasheeka is desperate to find out if Aaron is her Prince Charming. It's up to Julie and Oobah to see if this online romance has a fairy tale ending. (S1, ep3)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Emma & Harry
programme.desc: After six months, single mum Emma and online love Harry have already set a wedding date. But the problem is, they've never met. So it's up to the Catfish UK team to track him down. (S1, ep8)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Jerry & Karla
programme.desc: Jerry needs help meeting his first love Karla. Karla claims to have already met Jerry but refuses to talk to him on the phone. Can Oobah and Nella find out if Karla is who she says she is? (S2, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Luke & Amy
programme.desc: Drummer Luke first started talking to nurse Amy when she came to one of his gigs 6 months ago. They had an instant spark but unfortunately every time they try and meet she cancels. (S2, ep9)

programme.title: Teen Mom UK: Enough Is Enough
programme.desc: It's all kicking off as Chloe loses it with Jordan, Sassi breaks down over Darren, Amber's confession backfires, Megan's in a bad place and Mia has something to say to Manley's mum. (S3, ep3)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: In September 1999, Brian Eftenoff of Phoenix, Az. Was convicted of murdering his wife, Judi. It was alleged that Eftenoff forced more than a gram of cocaine down his wife’s throat causing her to die of a cocaine-induced stroke.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Texas Confidential
programme.desc: A report on the 1997 murder of Doris Angleton, the wife of a successful Houston, Texas bookie. Doris’ husband Bob who claimed that his brother Roger was Doris’ killer, was tried for the crime in state court and acquitted. But the case did not end there.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Fight For The Truth
programme.desc: 17-year-old Marty Tankleff was convicted of murdering his adoptive parents in their home. Marty initially confessed, but quickly recanted. He has fought for years for his innocence, as new witnesses have surfaced who could potentially exonerate him.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Strange Truth
programme.desc: In March 2003, Ramona Krotine left an office party and was never seen alive again. 24 hours later, she was found in the trunk of her car, beaten and shot to death. At first, police suspected a botched robbery but later believed her husband was to blame.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Last Confession
programme.desc: Relatives of a beauty queen who was murdered more than 50 years ago suspect a priest committed the crime.
